summary.long: Luke is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Many have attempted to write about what had taken place among us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They received their information from those who had been eyewitnesses and servants of God’s word from the beginning, and they passed it on to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, too, have followed everything closely from the beginning. So I thought it would be a good idea to write an orderly account for Your Excellency, Theophilus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way you will know that what you’ve been told is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Herod was king of Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the division of priests named after Abijah. Zechariah’s wife Elizabeth was a descendant of Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah and Elizabeth had God’s approval. They followed all the Lord’s commands and regulations perfectly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet, they never had any children because Elizabeth couldn’t become pregnant. Both of them were too old to have children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah was on duty with his division of priests. As he served in God’s presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he was chosen by priestly custom to go into the Lord’s temple to burn incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people were praying outside while he was burning incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, to the right of the incense altar, an angel of the Lord appeared to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah was troubled and overcome with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to him, “Don’t be afraid, Zechariah! God has heard your prayer. Your wife Elizabeth will have a son, and you will name him John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be your pride and joy, and many people will be glad that he was born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As far as the Lord is concerned, he will be a great man. He will never drink wine or any other liquor. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit even before he is born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will bring many people in Israel back to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will go ahead of the Lord with the spirit and power that Elijah had. He will change parents’ attitudes toward their children. He will change disobedient people so that they will accept the wisdom of those who have God’s approval. In this way he will prepare the people for their Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah said to the angel, “What proof is there for this? I’m an old man, and my wife is beyond her childbearing years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered him, “I’m Gabriel! I stand in God’s presence. God sent me to tell you this good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because you didn’t believe what I said, you will be unable to talk until the day this happens. Everything will come true at the right time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the people were waiting for Zechariah. They were amazed that he was staying in the temple so long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he did come out, he was unable to speak to them. So they realized that he had seen a vision in the temple. He motioned to them but remained unable to talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the days of his service were over, he went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, his wife Elizabeth became pregnant and didn’t go out in public for five months. She said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord has done this for me now. He has removed my public disgrace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six months after Elizabeth had become pregnant, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a city in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel went to a virgin promised in marriage to a descendant of David named Joseph. The virgin’s name was Mary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the angel entered her home, he greeted her and said, “You are favored by the Lord! The Lord is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She was startled by what the angel said and tried to figure out what this greeting meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angel told her,
“Don’t be afraid, Mary. You have found favor with God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
You will become pregnant, give birth to a son,
    and name him Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be a great man
    and will be called the Son of the Most High.
    The Lord God will give him
    the throne of his ancestor David.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
Your son will be king of Jacob’s people forever,
    and his kingdom will never end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary asked the angel, “How can this be? I’ve never had sexual intercourse.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come to you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore, the holy child developing inside you will be called the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Elizabeth, your relative, is six months pregnant with a son in her old age. People said she couldn’t have a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But nothing is impossible for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mary answered, “I am the Lord’s servant. Let everything you’ve said happen to me.”
Then the angel left her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterward, Mary hurried to a city in the mountain region of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She entered Zechariah’s home and greeted Elizabeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Elizabeth heard the greeting, she felt the baby kick. Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said in a loud voice, “You are the most blessed of all women, and blessed is the child that you will have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I feel blessed that the mother of my Lord is visiting me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as I heard your greeting, I felt the baby jump for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are blessed for believing that the Lord would keep his promise to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mary said,
“My soul praises the Lord’s greatness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My spirit finds its joy in God, my Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he has looked favorably on me, his humble servant.
“From now on, all people will call me blessed
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Almighty has done great things to me.
    His name is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For those who fear him,
    his mercy lasts throughout every generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He displayed his mighty power.
    He scattered those who think too highly of themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He pulled strong rulers from their thrones.
    He honored humble people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He fed hungry people with good food.
    He sent rich people away with nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He remembered to help his servant Israel forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the promise he made to our ancestors,
    to Abraham and his descendants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months and then went back home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time came for Elizabeth to have her child, she gave birth to a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had been very kind to her, and they shared her joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the child was eight days old, they went to the temple to circumcise him. They were going to name him Zechariah after his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his mother spoke up, “Absolutely not! His name will be John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their friends said to her, “But you don’t have any relatives with that name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they motioned to the baby’s father to see what he wanted to name the child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” Everyone was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, Zechariah was able to speak, and he began to praise God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All their neighbors were filled with awe. Throughout the mountain region of Judea, people talked about everything that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who heard about it seriously thought it over and asked, “What does the future hold for this child?” It was clear that the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Praise the Lord God of Israel!
    He has come to take care of his people
        and to set them free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has raised up a mighty Savior for us
    in the family of his servant David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made this promise through his holy prophets long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He promised to save us from our enemies
    and from the power of all who hate us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has shown his mercy to our ancestors
    and remembered his holy promise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the oath that he swore to our ancestor Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He promised to rescue us from our enemies’ power
    so that we could serve him without fear
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by being holy and honorable as long as we live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High.
    You will go ahead of the Lord to prepare his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will make his people know that they can be saved
    through the forgiveness of their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A new day will dawn on us from above
    because our God is loving and merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will give light to those who live in the dark
    and in death’s shadow.
    He will guide us into the way of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child John grew and became spiritually strong. He lived in the desert until the day he appeared to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Emperor Augustus ordered a census of the Roman Empire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the first census taken while Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people went to register in the cities where their ancestors had lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph went from Nazareth, a city in Galilee, to a Judean city called Bethlehem. Joseph, a descendant of King David, went to Bethlehem because David had been born there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph went there to register with Mary. She had been promised to him in marriage and was pregnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were in Bethlehem, the time came for Mary to have her child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She gave birth to her firstborn son. She wrapped him in strips of cloth and laid him in a manger because there wasn’t any room for them in the inn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shepherds were in the fields near Bethlehem. They were taking turns watching their flock during the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An angel from the Lord suddenly appeared to them. The glory of the Lord filled the area with light, and they were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid! I have good news for you, a message that will fill everyone with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today your Savior, Christ the Lord, was born in David’s city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you will recognize him: You will find an infant wrapped in strips of cloth and lying in a manger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, a large army of angels appeared with the angel. They were praising God by saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Glory to God in the highest heaven,
    and on earth peace to those who have his good will!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angels left them and went back to heaven. The shepherds said to each other, “Let’s go to Bethlehem and see what the Lord has told us about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went quickly and found Mary and Joseph with the baby, who was lying in a manger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the child, they repeated what they had been told about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who heard the shepherds’ story was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary treasured all these things in her heart and always thought about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the shepherds returned to their flock, they glorified and praised God for everything they had seen and heard. Everything happened the way the angel had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eight days after his birth, the child was circumcised and named Yeshua. This was the name the angel had given him before his mother became pregnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the days required by Moses’ Teachings to make a mother clean had passed, Joseph and Mary went to Jerusalem. They took Yeshua to present him to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did exactly what was written in the Lord’s Teachings: “Every firstborn boy is to be set apart as holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also offered a sacrifice as required by the Lord’s Teachings: “a pair of mourning doves or two young pigeons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Simeon was in Jerusalem. He lived an honorable and devout life. He was waiting for the one who would comfort Israel. The Holy Spirit was with Simeon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and had told him that he wouldn’t die until he had seen the Messiah, whom the Lord would send.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moved by the Spirit, Simeon went into the temple courtyard. Mary and Joseph were bringing the child Yeshua into the courtyard at the same time. They brought him so that they could do for him what Moses’ Teachings required.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simeon took the child in his arms and praised God by saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now, Lord, you are allowing your servant to leave in peace
    as you promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes have seen your salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which you have prepared for all people to see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is a light that will reveal salvation to the nations
    and bring glory to your people Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua’s father and mother were amazed at what was said about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary, his mother, “This child is the reason that many people in Israel will be condemned and many others will be saved. He will be a sign that will expose
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the thoughts of those who reject him. And a sword will pierce your heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anna, a prophet, was also there. She was a descendant of Phanuel from the tribe of Asher. She was now very old. Her husband had died seven years after they were married,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and she had been a widow for 84 years. Anna never left the temple courtyard but worshiped day and night by fasting and praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment she came up to Mary and Joseph and began to thank God. She spoke about Yeshua to all who were waiting for Jerusalem to be set free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After doing everything the Lord’s Teachings required, Joseph and Mary returned to their hometown of Nazareth in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The child grew and became strong. He was filled with wisdom, and God’s favor was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every year Yeshua’s parents would go to Jerusalem for the Passover festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was 12 years old, they went as usual.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the festival was over, they left for home. The boy Yeshua stayed behind in Jerusalem, but his parents didn’t know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They thought that he was with the others who were traveling with them. After traveling for a day, they started to look for him among their relatives and friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they didn’t find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three days later, they found him in the temple courtyard. He was sitting among the teachers, listening to them, and asking them questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His understanding and his answers stunned everyone who heard him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his parents saw him, they were shocked. His mother asked him, “Son, why have you done this to us? Your father and I have been worried sick looking for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you realize that I had to be in my Father’s house?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But they didn’t understand what he meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he returned with them to Nazareth and was obedient to them.
His mother treasured all these things in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua grew in wisdom and maturity. He gained favor from God and people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the fifteenth year in the reign of the Emperor Tiberius. Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea. Herod ruled Galilee, and his brother Philip ruled Iturea and Trachonitis. Lysanias was the ruler of Abilene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was at the time when Annas and Caiaphas were chief priests that God spoke to John, son of Zechariah, in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John traveled throughout the region around the Jordan River. He told people about a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the prophet Isaiah wrote in his book,
“A voice cries out in the desert:
    ‘Prepare the way for the Lord!
    Make his paths straight!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every valley will be filled.
        Every mountain and hill will be leveled.
            The crooked ways will be made straight.
            The rough roads will be made smooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All people will see the salvation that God gives.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crowds of people were coming to be baptized by John. He would say to them, “You poisonous snakes! Who showed you how to flee from God’s coming anger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do those things that prove that you have turned to God and have changed the way you think and act. Don’t say, ‘Abraham is our ancestor.’ I guarantee that God can raise up descendants for Abraham from these stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ax is now ready to cut the roots of the trees. Any tree that doesn’t produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into a fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowds asked him, “What should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “Whoever has two shirts should share with the person who doesn’t have any. Whoever has food should share it too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some tax collectors came to be baptized. They asked him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Don’t collect more money than you are ordered to collect.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some soldiers asked him, “And what should we do?”
He told them, “Be satisfied with your pay, and never use threats or blackmail to get money from anyone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People’s hopes were rising as they all wondered whether John was the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John replied to all of them, “I baptize you with water. But the one who is more powerful than I is coming. I am not worthy to untie his sandal straps. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His winnowing shovel is in his hand to clean up his threshing floor. He will gather the wheat into his barn, but he will burn the husks in a fire that can never be put out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many other encouraging words, he told the Good News to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John spoke out against the ruler Herod because Herod had married his own sister-in-law, Herodias. He also spoke out against Herod for all the evil things he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herod added one more evil to all the others; he locked John in prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people were baptized, Yeshua, too, was baptized. While he was praying, heaven opened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Holy Spirit came down to him in the form of a dove. A voice from heaven said, “You are my Son, whom I love. I am pleased with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua was about 30 years old when he began his ministry.
Yeshua, so people thought, was the son of Joseph, son of Eli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Matthat, son of Levi, son of Melchi, son of Jannai, son of Joseph,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Mattathias, son of Amos, son of Nahum, son of Esli, son of Naggai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Maath, son of Mattathias, son of Semein, son of Josech, son of Joda,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Joanan, son of Rhesa, son of Zerubbabel, son of Shealtiel, son of Neri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Melchi, son of Addi, son of Cosam, son of Elmadam, son of Er,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Joshua, son of Eliezer, son of Jorim, son of Matthat, son of Levi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Simeon, son of Judah, son of Joseph, son of Jonam, son of Eliakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Melea, son of Menna, son of Mattatha, son of Nathan, son of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Jesse, son of Obed, son of Boaz, son of Salmon, son of Nahshon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Amminadab, son of Admin, son of Arni, son of Hezron, son of Perez, son of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Jacob, son of Isaac, son of Abraham, son of Terah, son of Nahor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Serug, son of Reu, son of Peleg, son of Eber, son of Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Cainan, son of Arphaxad, son of Shem, son of Noah, son of Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Methuselah, son of Enoch, son of Jared, son of Mahalaleel, son of Cainan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
son of Enos, son of Seth,
son of Adam,
son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua was filled with the Holy Spirit as he left the Jordan River. The Spirit led him while he was in the desert,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where he was tempted by the devil for 40 days. During those days Yeshua ate nothing, so when they were over, he was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become a loaf of bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered him, “Scripture says, ‘A person cannot live on bread alone.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The devil took him to a high place and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in an instant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil said to him, “I will give you all the power and glory of these kingdoms. All of it has been given to me, and I give it to anyone I please.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you will worship me, all this will be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered him, “Scripture says, ‘Worship the Lord your God and serve only him.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the devil took him into Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest part of the temple. He said to Yeshua, “If you are the Son of God, jump from here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Scripture says, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you to watch over you carefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will carry you in their hands so that you never hit your foot against a rock.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered him, “It has been said, ‘Never tempt the Lord your God.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After the devil had finished tempting Yeshua in every possible way, the devil left him until another time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua returned to Galilee. The power of the Spirit was with him, and the news about him spread throughout the surrounding country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught in the synagogues, and everyone praised him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. As usual he went into the synagogue on the day of worship. He stood up to read the lesson.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The attendant gave him the book of the prophet Isaiah. He opened it and found the place where it read:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is with me.
    He has anointed me
        to tell the Good News to the poor.
    He has sent me
        to announce forgiveness to the prisoners of sin
            and the restoring of sight to the blind,
        to forgive those who have been shattered by sin,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: to announce the year of the Lord’s favor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua closed the book, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. Everyone in the synagogue watched him closely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “This passage came true today when you heard me read it.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All the people spoke well of him. They were amazed to hear the gracious words flowing from his lips. They said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said to them, “You’ll probably quote this proverb to me, ‘Doctor, cure yourself!’ and then say to me, ‘Do all the things in your hometown that we’ve heard you’ve done in Capernaum.’”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Yeshua added, “I can guarantee this truth: A prophet isn’t accepted in his hometown.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: There were many widows in Israel in Elijah’s time. It had not rained for three-and-a-half years, and the famine was severe everywhere in the country.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But God didn’t send Elijah to anyone except a widow at Zarephath in the territory of Sidon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: There were also many people with skin diseases in Israel in the prophet Elisha’s time. But God cured no one except Naaman from Syria.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone in the synagogue became furious when they heard this.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Their city was built on a hill with a cliff. So they got up, forced Yeshua out of the city, and led him to the cliff. They intended to throw him off of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua walked right by them and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went to Capernaum, a city in Galilee, and taught them on a day of worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were amazed at his teachings because he spoke with authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the synagogue was a man possessed by a spirit, an evil demon. He shouted very loudly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oh, no! What do you want with us, Yeshua from Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Yeshua ordered the spirit, “Keep quiet, and come out of him!” The demon threw the man down in the middle of the synagogue and came out without hurting him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone was stunned. They said to one another, “What kind of command is this? With authority and power he gives orders to evil spirits, and they come out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So news about him spread to every place throughout the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua left the synagogue and went to Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was sick with a high fever. They asked Yeshua to help her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bent over her, ordered the fever to leave, and it went away. She got up immediately and prepared a meal for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun was setting, everyone who had friends suffering from various diseases brought them to him. He placed his hands on each of them and cured them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Demons came out of many people, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But Yeshua ordered them not to speak. After all, they knew he was the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the morning he went to a place where he could be alone. The crowds searched for him. When they came to him, they tried to keep him from leaving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “I have to tell the Good News about the kingdom of God in other cities also. That’s what I was sent to do.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So he spread his message in the synagogues of Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Yeshua was standing by the Sea of Galilee. The people crowded around him as they listened to God’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua saw two boats on the shore. The fishermen had stepped out of them and were washing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yeshua got into the boat that belonged to Simon and asked him to push off a little from the shore. Then Yeshua sat down and taught the crowd from the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he finished speaking, he told Simon, “Take the boat into deep water, and lower your nets to catch some fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon answered, “Teacher, we worked hard all night and caught nothing. But if you say so, I’ll lower the nets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the men had done this, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. Their partners came and filled both boats until the boats nearly sank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Simon Peter saw this, he knelt in front of Yeshua and said, “Leave me, Lord! I’m a sinful person!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and everyone who was with him were amazed to see the large number of fish they had caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
James and John, who were Zebedee’s sons and Simon’s partners, were also amazed.
Yeshua told Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will catch people instead of fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and his partners brought the boats to shore, left everything, and followed Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Yeshua was in a city where there was a man covered with a serious skin disease. When the man saw Yeshua, he bowed with his face to the ground. He begged Yeshua, “Sir, if you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua reached out, touched him, and said, “I want to. So be clean!” Immediately, his skin disease went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua ordered him, “Don’t tell anyone. Instead, show yourself to the priest. Then offer the sacrifice as Moses commanded as proof to people that you are clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The news about Yeshua spread even more. Large crowds gathered to hear him and have their diseases cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he would go away to places where he could be alone for prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day when Yeshua was teaching, some Pharisees and experts in Moses’ Teachings were present. They had come from every village in Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. Yeshua had the power of the Lord to heal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men brought a paralyzed man on a stretcher. They tried to take him into the house and put him in front of Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they could not find a way to get him into the house because of the crowd. So they went up on the roof. They made an opening in the tiles and let the man down on his stretcher among the people. (They lowered him in front of Yeshua.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua saw their faith, he said, “Sir, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in Moses’ Teachings and the Pharisees thought, “Who is this man? He’s dishonoring God! Who besides God can forgive sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua knew what they were thinking. So he said to them, “What are you thinking?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up and walk’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” Then he said to the paralyzed man, “Get up, pick up your stretcher, and go home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man immediately stood up in front of them and picked up the stretcher he had been lying on. Praising God, he went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was amazed and praised God. They were filled with awe and said, “We’ve seen things today we can hardly believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, Yeshua left. He saw a tax collector named Levi sitting in a tax office. Yeshua said to him, “Follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Levi got up, left everything, and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi held a large reception at his home for Yeshua. A huge crowd of tax collectors and others were eating with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and their experts in Moses’ Teachings complained to Yeshua’s disciples. They asked, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered them, “Healthy people don’t need a doctor; those who are sick do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve come to call sinners to change the way they think and act, not to call people who think they have God’s approval.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “John’s disciples frequently fast and say prayers, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees. But your disciples eat and drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked them, “Can you force wedding guests to fast while the groom is still with them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time will come when the groom will be taken away from them. At that time they will fast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also used these illustrations: “No one tears a piece of cloth from a new coat to patch an old coat. Otherwise, the new cloth will tear the old. Besides, the patch from the new will not match the old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People don’t pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the new wine will make the skins burst. The wine will run out, and the skins will be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, new wine is to be poured into fresh skins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one who has been drinking old wine wants new wine. He says, ‘The old wine is better!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once, on a day of worship, Yeshua was walking through some grainfields. His disciples were picking the heads of grain, removing the husks, and eating the grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees asked, “Why are your disciples doing something that is not right to do on the day of worship?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered them, “Haven’t you read what David did when he and his men were hungry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haven’t you read how he went into the house of God, ate the bread of the presence, and gave some of it to the men who were with him? He had no right to eat those loaves. Only the priests have that right.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he added, “The Son of Man has authority over the day of worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On another day of worship, Yeshua went into a synagogue to teach. A man whose right hand was paralyzed was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in Moses’ Teachings and the Pharisees were watching Yeshua closely. They wanted to see whether he would heal the man on the day of worship so that they could find a way to accuse him of doing something wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua knew what they were thinking. So he told the man with the paralyzed hand, “Get up, and stand in the center of the synagogue!” The man got up and stood there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to them, “I ask you—what is the right thing to do on a day of worship: to do good or evil, to give a person his health or to destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around at all of them and then said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man did so, and his hand became normal again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in Moses’ Teachings and Pharisees were furious and began to discuss with each other what they could do to Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Yeshua went to a mountain to pray. He spent the whole night in prayer to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was day, he called his disciples. He chose twelve of them and called them apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were Simon (whom Yeshua named Peter) and Simon’s brother Andrew, James, John, Philip, Bartholomew,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Matthew, Thomas, James (son of Alphaeus), Simon (who was called the Zealot),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (son of James), and Judas Iscariot (who became a traitor).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua came down from the mountain with them and stood on a level place. A large crowd of his disciples and many other people were there. They had come from all over Judea, Jerusalem, and the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They wanted to hear him and be cured of their diseases. Those who were tormented by evil spirits were cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire crowd was trying to touch him because power was coming from him and curing all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua looked at his disciples and said,
“Blessed are those who are poor.
    The kingdom of God is theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who are hungry.
    They will be satisfied.
    Blessed are those who are crying.
    They will laugh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are you when people hate you, avoid you,
    insult you, and slander you
        because you are committed to the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice then, and be very happy!
    You have a great reward in heaven.
        That’s the way their ancestors treated the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But how horrible it will be for those who are rich.
    They have had their comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How horrible it will be for those who are well-fed.
    They will be hungry.
    How horrible it will be for those who are laughing.
    They will mourn and cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How horrible it will be for you
    when everyone says nice things about you.
        That’s the way their ancestors treated the false prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I tell everyone who is listening: Love your enemies. Be kind to those who hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bless those who curse you. Pray for those who insult you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone strikes you on the cheek, offer the other cheek as well. If someone takes your coat, don’t stop him from taking your shirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give to everyone who asks you for something. If someone takes what is yours, don’t insist on getting it back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do for other people everything you want them to do for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love those who love you, do you deserve any thanks for that? Even sinners love those who love them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you help those who help you, do you deserve any thanks for that? Sinners do that too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you lend anything to those from whom you expect to get something back, do you deserve any thanks for that? Sinners also lend to sinners to get back what they lend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, love your enemies, help them, and lend to them without expecting to get anything back. Then you will have a great reward. You will be the children of the Most High God. After all, he is kind to unthankful and evil people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be merciful as your Father is merciful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stop judging, and you will never be judged. Stop condemning, and you will never be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give, and you will receive. A large quantity, pressed together, shaken down, and running over will be put into your pocket. The standards you use for others will be applied to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua also gave them this illustration: “Can one blind person lead another? Won’t both fall into the same pit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A student is no better than his teacher. But everyone who is well-trained will be like his teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you see the piece of sawdust in another believer’s eye and not notice the wooden beam in your own eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you say to another believer, ‘Friend, let me take the piece of sawdust out of your eye,’ when you don’t see the beam in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye. Then you will see clearly to remove the piece of sawdust from another believer’s eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A good tree doesn’t produce rotten fruit, and a rotten tree doesn’t produce good fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each tree is known by its fruit. You don’t pick figs from thorny plants or grapes from a thornbush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Good people do the good that is in them. But evil people do the evil that is in them. The things people say come from inside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me Lord but don’t do what I tell you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will show you what everyone who comes to me, hears what I say, and obeys it is like.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is like a person who dug down to bedrock to lay the foundation of his home. When a flood came, the floodwaters pushed against that house. But the house couldn’t be washed away because it had a good foundation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who hears what I say but doesn’t obey it is like someone who built a house on the ground without any foundation. The floodwaters pushed against it, and that house quickly collapsed and was destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua had finished everything he wanted to say to the people, he went to Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There a Roman army officer’s valuable slave was sick and near death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officer had heard about Yeshua and sent some Jewish leaders to him. They were to ask Yeshua to come and save the servant’s life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Yeshua and begged, “He deserves your help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He loves our people and built our synagogue at his own expense.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went with them. He was not far from the house when the officer sent friends to tell Yeshua, “Sir, don’t bother. I don’t deserve to have you come into my house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why I didn’t come to you. But just give a command, and let my servant be cured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you know, I’m in a chain of command and have soldiers at my command. I tell one of them, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and another, ‘Come!’ and he comes. I tell my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua was amazed at the officer when he heard these words. He turned to the crowd following him and said, “I can guarantee that I haven’t found faith as great as this in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men who had been sent returned to the house, they found the servant healthy again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon afterward, Yeshua went to a city called Nain. His disciples and a large crowd went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he came near the entrance to the city, he met a funeral procession. The dead man was a widow’s only child. A large crowd from the city was with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord saw her, he felt sorry for her. He said to her, “Don’t cry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went up to the open coffin, took hold of it, and the men who were carrying it stopped. He said, “Young man, I’m telling you to come back to life!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dead man sat up and began to talk, and Yeshua gave him back to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was struck with fear and praised God. They said, “A great prophet has appeared among us,” and “God has taken care of his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This news about Yeshua spread throughout Judea and the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s disciples told him about all these things. Then John called two of his disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent them to ask the Lord, “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men came to Yeshua and said, “John the Baptizer sent us to ask you, ‘Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for someone else?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Yeshua was curing many people who had diseases, sicknesses, and evil spirits. Also, he was giving back sight to many who were blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered John’s disciples, “Go back, and tell John what you have seen and heard: Blind people see again, lame people are walking, those with skin diseases are made clean, deaf people hear again, dead people are brought back to life, and poor people hear the Good News.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever doesn’t lose his faith in me is indeed blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s messengers had left, Yeshua spoke to the crowds about John. “What did you go into the desert to see? Tall grass swaying in the wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Really, what did you go to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? Those who wear splendid clothes and live in luxury are in royal palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Really, what did you go to see? A prophet? Let me tell you that he is far more than a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
John is the one about whom Scripture says,
‘I am sending my messenger ahead of you
    to prepare the way in front of you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that of all the people ever born, no one is greater than John. Yet, the least important person in the kingdom of God is greater than John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the people, including tax collectors, heard John. They admitted that God was right by letting John baptize them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the experts in Moses’ Teachings rejected God’s plan for them. They refused to be baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How can I describe the people who are living now? What are they like?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like children who sit in the marketplace and shout to each other,
‘We played music for you,
    but you didn’t dance.
    We sang a funeral song,
    but you didn’t cry.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John the Baptizer has come neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘There’s a demon in him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look at him! He’s a glutton and a drunk, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet, wisdom is proved right by all its results.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the Pharisees invited Yeshua to eat with him. Yeshua went to the Pharisee’s house and was eating at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman who lived a sinful life in that city found out that Yeshua was eating at the Pharisee’s house. So she took a bottle of perfume
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and knelt at his feet. She was crying and washed his feet with her tears. Then she dried his feet with her hair, kissed them over and over again, and poured the perfume on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee who had invited Yeshua saw this and thought, “If this man really were a prophet, he would know what sort of woman is touching him. She’s a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua spoke up, “Simon, I have something to say to you.”
Simon replied, “Teacher, you’re free to speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yeshua said, “Two men owed a moneylender some money. One owed him five hundred silver coins, and the other owed him fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they couldn’t pay it back, he was kind enough to cancel their debts. Now, who do you think will love him the most?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon answered, “I suppose the one who had the largest debt canceled.”
Yeshua said to him, “You’re right!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, turning to the woman, he said to Simon, “You see this woman, don’t you? I came into your house. You didn’t wash my feet. But she has washed my feet with her tears and dried them with her hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t give me a kiss. But ever since I came in, she has not stopped kissing my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t put any olive oil on my head. But she has poured perfume on my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why I’m telling you that her many sins have been forgiven. Her great love proves that. But whoever receives little forgiveness loves very little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to her, “Your sins have been forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other guests thought, “Who is this man who even forgives sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Yeshua traveled from one city and village to another. He spread the Good News about God’s kingdom. The twelve apostles were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, some women were with him. They had been cured from evil spirits and various illnesses. These women were Mary, also called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joanna, whose husband Chusa was Herod’s administrator; Susanna; and many other women. They provided financial support for Yeshua and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a large crowd had gathered and people had come to Yeshua from every city, he used this story as an illustration:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A farmer went to plant his seeds. Some seeds were planted along the road, were trampled, and were devoured by birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were planted on rocky soil. When the plants came up, they withered because they had no moisture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were planted among thornbushes. The thornbushes grew up with them and choked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Others were planted on good ground. When they came up, they produced a hundred times as much as was planted.”
After he had said this, he called out, “Let the person who has ears listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him what this story meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered, “Knowledge about the mysteries of the kingdom of God has been given directly to you. But it is given to others in stories. When they look, they don’t see, and when they hear, they don’t understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the story illustrates: The seed is God’s word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people are like seeds that were planted along the road. They hear the word, but then the devil comes. He takes the word away from them so that they don’t believe and become saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people are like seeds on rocky soil. They welcome the word with joy whenever they hear it, but they don’t develop any roots. They believe for a while, but when their faith is tested, they abandon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seeds that were planted among thornbushes are people who hear the word, but as life goes on the worries, riches, and pleasures of life choke them. So they don’t produce anything good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seeds that were planted on good ground are people who also hear the word. But they keep it in their good and honest hearts and produce what is good despite what life may bring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one lights a lamp and hides it under a bowl or puts it under a bed. Instead, everyone who lights a lamp puts it on a lamp stand so that those who come in will see the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is nothing hidden that will not be revealed. There is nothing kept secret that will not come to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So pay attention to how you listen! Those who understand these mysteries will be given more knowledge. However, some people don’t understand these mysteries. Even what they think they understand will be taken away from them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His mother and his brothers came to see him. But they couldn’t meet with him because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone told Yeshua, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside. They want to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “My mother and my brothers are those who hear and do what God’s word says.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Yeshua and his disciples got into a boat. He said to them, “Let’s cross to the other side of the lake.” So they started out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they were sailing along, Yeshua fell asleep.
A violent storm came across the lake. The boat was taking on water, and they were in danger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They went to him, woke him up, and said, “Master! Master! We’re going to die!”
Then he got up and ordered the wind and the waves to stop. The wind stopped, and the sea became calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “Where is your faith?”
Frightened and amazed, they asked each other, “Who is this man? He gives orders to the wind and the water, and they obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They landed in the region of the Gerasenes across from Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua stepped out on the shore, a certain man from the city met him. The man was possessed by demons and had not worn clothes for a long time. He would not stay in a house but lived in the tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Yeshua, he shouted, fell in front of him, and said in a loud voice, “Why are you bothering me, Yeshua, Son of the Most High God? I beg you not to torture me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua ordered the evil spirit to come out of the man. (The evil spirit had controlled the man for a long time. People had kept him under guard. He was chained hand and foot. But he would break the chains. Then the demon would force him to go into the desert.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked him, “What is your name?”
He answered, “Legion [Six Thousand].” (Many demons had entered him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons begged Yeshua not to order them to go into the bottomless pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large herd of pigs was feeding on a mountainside. The demons begged Yeshua to let them enter those pigs. So he let them do this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons came out of the man and went into the pigs. Then the herd rushed down the cliff into the lake and drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When those who had taken care of the pigs saw what had happened, they ran away. They reported everything in the city and countryside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people went to see what had happened. They came to Yeshua and found the man from whom the demons had gone out. Dressed and in his right mind, he was sitting at Yeshua’s feet. The people were frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seen this told the people how Yeshua had restored the demon-possessed man to health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then all the people from the surrounding region of the Gerasenes asked Yeshua to leave because they were terrified.
Yeshua got into a boat and started back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The man from whom the demons had gone out begged him, “Let me go with you.”
But Yeshua sent the man away and told him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go home to your family, and tell them how much God has done for you.” So the man left. He went through the whole city and told people how much Yeshua had done for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua came back, a crowd welcomed him. Everyone was expecting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Jairus, a synagogue leader, arrived and quickly bowed down in front of Yeshua. He begged Yeshua to come to his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His only daughter, who was about twelve years old, was dying. As Yeshua went, the people were crowding around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman who had been suffering from chronic bleeding for twelve years was in the crowd. No one could cure her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came up behind Yeshua, touched the edge of his clothes, and her bleeding stopped at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua asked, “Who touched me?”
After everyone denied touching him, Peter said, “Teacher, the people are crowding you and pressing against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “Someone touched me. I know power has gone out of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman saw that she couldn’t hide. Trembling, she quickly bowed in front of him. There, in front of all the people, she told why she touched him and how she was cured at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Yeshua was still speaking to her, someone came from the synagogue leader’s home. He said, “Your daughter is dead. Don’t bother the teacher anymore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua heard this, he told the synagogue leader, “Don’t be afraid! Just believe, and she will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went into the house. He allowed no one to go with him except Peter, John, James, and the child’s parents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was crying and showing how sad they were. Yeshua said, “Don’t cry! She’s not dead. She’s just sleeping.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They laughed at him because they knew she was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua took her hand and called out, “Child, get up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She came back to life and got up at once. He ordered her parents to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were amazed. Yeshua ordered them not to tell anyone what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua called the twelve apostles together and gave them power and authority over every demon and power and authority to cure diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent them to spread the message about the kingdom of God and to cure the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Don’t take anything along on the trip. Don’t take a walking stick, traveling bag, any food, money, or a change of clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you go into a home, stay there until you’re ready to leave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If people don’t welcome you, leave that city, and shake its dust off your feet as a warning to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles went from village to village, told the Good News, and cured the sick everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod the ruler heard about everything that was happening. He didn’t know what to make of it. Some people were saying that John had come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said that Elijah had appeared, and still others said that one of the prophets from long ago had come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod said, “I had John’s head cut off. Who is this person I’m hearing so much about?” So Herod wanted to see Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles came back and told Yeshua everything they had done. He took them with him to a city called Bethsaida so that they could be alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the crowds found out about this and followed him. He welcomed them, talked to them about the kingdom of God, and cured those who were sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Toward the end of the day, the twelve apostles came to him. They said to him, “Send the crowd to the closest villages and farms so that they can find some food and a place to stay. No one lives around here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua replied, “You give them something to eat.”
They said to him, “We have five loaves of bread and two fish. Unless we go to buy food for all these people, that’s all we have.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(There were about five thousand men.)
Then he told his disciples, “Have them sit in groups of about fifty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they did this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the five loaves and the two fish, looked up to heaven, and blessed the food. He broke the loaves apart and kept giving them to the disciples to give to the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them ate as much as they wanted. When they picked up the leftover pieces, they filled twelve baskets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once when Yeshua was praying privately and his disciples were with him, he asked them, “Who do people say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “Some say you are John the Baptizer, others Elijah, and still others say that one of the prophets from long ago has come back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “But who do you say I am?”
Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, whom God has sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordered them not to tell this to anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said that the Son of Man would have to suffer a lot. He would be rejected by the leaders, the chief priests, and the experts in Moses’ Teachings. He would be killed, but on the third day he would come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to all of them, “Those who want to come with me must say no to the things they want, pick up their crosses every day, and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who want to save their lives will lose them. But those who lose their lives for me will save them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What good does it do for people to win the whole world but lose their lives by destroying them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If people are ashamed of me and what I say, the Son of Man will be ashamed of those people when he comes in the glory that he shares with the Father and the holy angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: Some people who are standing here will not die until they see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About eight days after he had said this, Yeshua took Peter, John, and James with him and went up a mountain to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Yeshua was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became dazzling white.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, both Moses and Elijah were talking with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They appeared in heavenly glory and were discussing Yeshua’s approaching death and what he was about to fulfill in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and the men with him were sleeping soundly. When they woke up, they saw Yeshua’s glory and the two men standing with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Moses and Elijah were leaving him, Peter said to Yeshua, “Teacher, it’s good that we’re here. Let’s put up three tents—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” Peter didn’t know what he was saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was saying this, a cloud overshadowed them. They were frightened as they went into the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A voice came out of the cloud and said, “This is my Son, whom I have chosen. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the voice had spoken, they saw that Yeshua was alone. The disciples said nothing, and for some time they told no one about what they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a large crowd met Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man in the crowd shouted, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son. He’s my only child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever a spirit takes control of him, he shrieks, goes into convulsions, and foams at the mouth. After a struggle, the spirit goes away, leaving the child worn out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I begged your disciples to force the spirit out of him, but they couldn’t do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered, “You unbelieving and corrupt generation! How long must I be with you and put up with you? Bring your son here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While he was coming to Yeshua, the demon knocked the boy to the ground and threw him into convulsions.
Yeshua ordered the evil spirit to leave. He cured the boy and gave him back to his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone was amazed to see God’s wonderful power.
Everyone was amazed at all the things that Yeshua was doing. So he said to his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen carefully to what I say. The Son of Man will be betrayed and handed over to people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t know what he meant. The meaning was hidden from them so that they didn’t understand it. Besides, they were afraid to ask him about what he had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A discussion started among them about who would be the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua knew what they were thinking. So he took a little child and had him stand beside him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Whoever welcomes this little child in my name welcomes me. Whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me. The one who is least among all of you is the one who is greatest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John replied, “Master, we saw someone forcing demons out of a person by using the power and authority of your name. We tried to stop him because he was not one of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “Don’t stop him! Whoever isn’t against you is for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time was coming closer for Yeshua to be taken to heaven. So he was determined to go to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent messengers ahead of him. They went into a Samaritan village to arrange a place for him to stay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people didn’t welcome him, because he was on his way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James and John, his disciples, saw this. They asked, “Lord, do you want us to call down fire from heaven to burn them up?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he turned and corrected them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went to another village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were walking along the road, a man said to Yeshua, “I’ll follow you wherever you go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told him, “Foxes have holes, and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to sleep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He told another man, “Follow me!”
But the man said, “Sir, first let me go to bury my father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua told him, “Let the dead bury their own dead. You must go everywhere and tell about the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another said, “I’ll follow you, sir, but first let me tell my family goodbye.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “Whoever starts to plow and looks back is not fit for the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, the Lord appointed 70 other disciples to go ahead of him to every city and place that he intended to go. They were to travel in pairs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “The harvest is large, but the workers are few. So ask the Lord who gives this harvest to send workers to harvest his crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go! I’m sending you out like lambs among wolves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t carry a wallet, a traveling bag, or sandals, and don’t stop to greet anyone on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you go into a house, greet the family right away with the words, ‘May there be peace in this house.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a peaceful person lives there, your greeting will be accepted. But if that’s not the case, your greeting will be rejected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stay with the family that accepts you. Eat and drink whatever they offer you. After all, the worker deserves his pay. Do not move around from one house to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you go into a city and the people welcome you, eat whatever they serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heal the sick that are there, and tell the people, ‘The kingdom of God is near you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But whenever you go into a city and people don’t welcome you, leave. Announce in its streets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘We are wiping your city’s dust from our feet in protest against you! But realize that the kingdom of God is near you!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that judgment day will be easier for Sodom than for that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you, Chorazin! How horrible it will be for you, Bethsaida! If the miracles worked in your cities had been worked in Tyre and Sidon, they would have changed the way they thought and acted. Long ago they would have worn sackcloth and sat in ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judgment day will be better for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted to heaven? No, you will go to hell!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The person who hears you hears me, and the person who rejects you rejects me. The person who rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The 70 disciples came back very happy. They said, “Lord, even demons obey us when we use the power and authority of your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “I watched Satan fall from heaven like lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given you the authority to trample snakes and scorpions and to destroy the enemy’s power. Nothing will hurt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, don’t be happy that evil spirits obey you. Be happy that your names are written in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that hour the Holy Spirit filled Yeshua with joy. Yeshua said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, for hiding these things from wise and intelligent people and revealing them to little children. Yes, Father, this is what pleased you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My Father has turned everything over to me. Only the Father knows who the Son is. And no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son is willing to reveal him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He turned to his disciples in private and said to them, “How blessed you are to see what you’ve seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that many prophets and kings wanted to see and hear what you’ve seen and heard, but they didn’t.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then an expert in Moses’ Teachings stood up to test Yeshua. He asked, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered him, “What is written in Moses’ Teachings? What do you read there?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “‘Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind. And love your neighbor as you love yourself.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told him, “You’re right! Do this, and life will be yours.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man wanted to justify his question. So he asked Yeshua, “Who is my neighbor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “A man went from Jerusalem to Jericho. On the way robbers stripped him, beat him, and left him for dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “By chance, a priest was traveling along that road. When he saw the man, he went around him and continued on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a Levite came to that place. When he saw the man, he, too, went around him and continued on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But a Samaritan, as he was traveling along, came across the man. When the Samaritan saw him, he felt sorry for the man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: went to him, and cleaned and bandaged his wounds. Then he put him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the Samaritan took out two silver coins and gave them to the innkeeper. He told the innkeeper, ‘Take care of him. If you spend more than that, I’ll pay you on my return trip.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of these three men, who do you think was a neighbor to the man who was attacked by robbers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The expert said, “The one who was kind enough to help him.”
Yeshua told him, “Go and imitate his example!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were traveling along, Yeshua went into a village. A woman named Martha welcomed him into her home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had a sister named Mary. Mary sat at the Lord’s feet and listened to him talk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Martha was upset about all the work she had to do. So she asked, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do the work all by myself? Tell her to help me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha! You worry and fuss about a lot of things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There’s only one thing you need. Mary has made the right choice, and that one thing will not be taken away from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once Yeshua was praying in a certain place. When he stopped praying, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray as John taught his disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua told them, “When you pray, say this:
Father,
    let your name be kept holy.
    Let your kingdom come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give us our bread day by day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forgive us as we forgive everyone else.
    Don’t allow us to be tempted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to his disciples, “Suppose one of you has a friend. Suppose you go to him at midnight and say, ‘Friend, let me borrow three loaves of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A friend of mine on a trip has dropped in on me, and I don’t have anything to serve him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your friend might answer you from inside his house, ‘Don’t bother me! The door is already locked, and my children are in bed. I can’t get up to give you anything.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that although he doesn’t want to get up to give you anything, he will get up and give you whatever you need because he is your friend and because you were so bold.
verses.speaker: Narrator
