verses.text: “So I tell you to ask, and you will receive. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will be opened for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who asks will receive. The one who searches will find, and for the person who knocks, the door will be opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your child asks you, his father, for a fish, would you give him a snake instead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if your child asks you for an egg, would you give him a scorpion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though you’re evil, you know how to give good gifts to your children. So how much more will your Father in heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yeshua was forcing a demon out of a man. The demon had made the man unable to talk. When the demon had gone out, the man began to talk.
The people were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “He can force demons out of people only with the help of Beelzebul, the ruler of demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others wanted to test Yeshua and demanded that he show them some miraculous sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Yeshua knew what they were thinking, he said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is ruined. A house divided against itself falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, if Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom last? I say this because you say Beelzebul helps me force demons out of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I force demons out with the help of Beelzebul, who helps your followers force them out? That’s why they will be your judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I force out demons with the help of God’s power, then the kingdom of God has come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own mansion, his property is safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a stronger man than he may attack him and defeat him. Then the stronger man will take away all the weapons in which the strong man trusted and will divide the loot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever isn’t with me is against me. Whoever doesn’t gather with me scatters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an evil spirit comes out of a person, it goes through dry places looking for a place to rest. But it doesn’t find any. Then it says, ‘I’ll go back to the home I left.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it comes, it finds the house swept clean and in order.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the spirit goes and brings along seven other spirits more evil than itself. They enter and take up permanent residence there. In the end the condition of that person is worse than it was before.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Yeshua was speaking, a woman in the crowd shouted, “How blessed is the mother who gave birth to you and the breasts that nursed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “Rather, how blessed are those who hear and obey God’s word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the people were gathering around him, Yeshua said, “The people living today are evil. They look for a miraculous sign. But the only sign they will get is the sign of Jonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Jonah became a miraculous sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a miraculous sign to the people living today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The queen from the south will stand up at the time of judgment with the men who live today. She will condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to hear Solomon’s wisdom. But look, someone greater than Solomon is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the time of judgment with the people living today. Since the men of Nineveh turned to God and changed the way they thought and acted when Jonah spoke his message, they will condemn the people living today. But look, someone greater than Jonah is here!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No one lights a lamp and hides it or puts it under a basket. Instead, everyone who lights a lamp puts it on a lamp stand so that those who come in will see its light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your eye is the lamp of your body. When your eye is unclouded, your whole body is full of light. But when your eye is evil, your body is full of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be careful that the light in you isn’t darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your whole body is full of light and not darkness, it will be as bright as a lamp shining on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Yeshua spoke, a Pharisee invited him to have lunch at his house. So Yeshua accepted the invitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee was surprised to see that Yeshua didn’t wash before the meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him, “You Pharisees clean the outside of cups and dishes. But inside you are full of greed and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You fools! Didn’t the one who made the outside make the inside too?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give what is inside as a gift to the poor, and then everything will be clean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you Pharisees! You give God one-tenth of your mint, spices, and every garden herb. But you have ignored justice and the love of God. You should have done these things without ignoring the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you Pharisees! You love to sit in the front seats in the synagogues and to be greeted in the marketplaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How horrible it will be for you! You are like unmarked graves. People walk on them without knowing what they are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the experts in Moses’ Teachings said to him, “Teacher, when you talk this way, you insult us too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “How horrible it will be for you experts in Moses’ Teachings! You burden people with loads that are hard to carry. But you won’t lift a finger to carry any of these loads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you! You build the monuments for the prophets. But it was your ancestors who murdered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you are witnesses and approve of what your ancestors did. They murdered the prophets for whom you build monuments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why the Wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles. They will murder some of those prophets and apostles and persecute others.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people living now will be charged with the murder of every prophet since the world was made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This includes the murders from Abel to Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the temple. Yes, I can guarantee this truth: The people living today will be held responsible for this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for you experts in Moses’ Teachings! You have taken away the key that unlocks knowledge. You haven’t gained entrance into knowledge yourselves, and you’ve kept out those who wanted to enter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua left, the experts in Moses’ Teachings and the Pharisees held a terrible grudge against him. They questioned him about many things
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and watched him closely to trap him in something he might say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, thousands of people had gathered. They were so crowded that they stepped on each other. Yeshua spoke to his disciples and said, “Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees. I’m talking about their hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing has been covered that will not be exposed. Whatever is secret will be made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the daylight. Whatever you have whispered in private rooms will be shouted from the housetops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My friends, I can guarantee that you don’t need to be afraid of those who kill the body. After that they can’t do anything more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll show you the one you should be afraid of. Be afraid of the one who has the power to throw you into hell after killing you. I’m warning you to be afraid of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aren’t five sparrows sold for two cents? God doesn’t forget any of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even every hair on your head has been counted. Don’t be afraid! You are worth more than many sparrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that the Son of Man will acknowledge in front of God’s angels every person who acknowledges him in front of others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God’s angels will be told that I don’t know those people who tell others that they don’t know me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who says something against the Son of Man will be forgiven. But the person who dishonors the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you are put on trial in synagogues or in front of rulers and authorities, don’t worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Holy Spirit will teach you what you must say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone in the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to give me my share of the inheritance that our father left us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “Who appointed me to be your judge or to divide your inheritance?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the people, “Be careful to guard yourselves from every kind of greed. Life is not about having a lot of material possessions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he used this illustration. He said, “A rich man had land that produced good crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He thought, ‘What should I do? I don’t have enough room to store my crops.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘I know what I’ll do. I’ll tear down my barns and build bigger ones so that I can store all my grain and goods in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I’ll say to myself, “You’ve stored up a lot of good things for years to come. Take life easy, eat, drink, and enjoy yourself.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But God said to him, ‘You fool! I will demand your life from you tonight! Now who will get what you’ve accumulated?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s how it is when a person has material riches but is not rich in his relationship with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to his disciples, “So I tell you to stop worrying about what you will eat or wear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider the crows. They don’t plant or harvest. They don’t even have a storeroom or a barn. Yet, God feeds them. You are worth much more than birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Can any of you add an hour to your life by worrying?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you can’t do a small thing like that, why worry about other things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider how the flowers grow. They never work or spin yarn for clothes. But I say that not even Solomon in all his majesty was dressed like one of these flowers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s the way God clothes the grass in the field. Today it’s alive, and tomorrow it’s thrown into an incinerator. So how much more will he clothe you people who have so little faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t concern yourself about what you will eat or drink, and quit worrying about these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone in the world is concerned about these things, but your Father knows you need them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, be concerned about his kingdom. Then these things will be provided for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid, little flock. Your Father is pleased to give you the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sell your material possessions, and give the money to the poor. Make yourselves wallets that don’t wear out! Make a treasure for yourselves in heaven that never loses its value! In heaven thieves and moths can’t get close enough to destroy your treasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your heart will be where your treasure is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be ready for action, and have your lamps burning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be like servants waiting to open the door at their master’s knock when he returns from a wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed are those servants whom the master finds awake when he comes. I can guarantee this truth: He will change his clothes, make them sit down at the table, and serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be blessed if he comes in the middle of the night or toward morning and finds them awake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of course, you realize that if the homeowner had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let him break into his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be ready, because the Son of Man will return when you least expect him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter asked, “Lord, did you use this illustration just for us or for everyone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord asked, “Who, then, is the faithful, skilled manager that the master will put in charge of giving the other servants their share of food at the right time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That servant will be blessed if his master finds him doing this job when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: He will put that servant in charge of all his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other hand, that servant may think that his master is taking a long time to come home. The servant may begin to beat the other servants and to eat, drink, and get drunk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His master will return at an unexpected time. Then his master will punish him severely and assign him a place with unfaithful people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant who knew what his master wanted but didn’t get ready to do it will receive a hard beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the servant who didn’t know what his master wanted and did things for which he deserved punishment will receive a light beating. A lot will be expected from everyone who has been given a lot. More will be demanded from everyone who has been entrusted with a lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have come to throw fire on the earth. I wish that it had already started!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have a baptism to go through, and I will suffer until it is over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you think I came to bring peace to earth? No! I can guarantee that I came to bring nothing but division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on a family of five will be divided. Three will be divided against two and two against three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A father will be against his son and a son against his father. A mother will be against her daughter and a daughter against her mother. A mother-in-law will be against her daughter-in-law and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud coming up in the west, you immediately say, ‘There’s going to be a rainstorm,’ and it happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you see a south wind blowing, you say, ‘It’s going to be hot,’ and that’s what happens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You hypocrites! You can forecast the weather by judging the appearance of earth and sky. But for some reason you don’t know how to judge the time in which you’re living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For instance, when an opponent brings you to court in front of a ruler, do your best to settle with him before you get there. Otherwise, he will drag you in front of a judge. The judge will hand you over to an officer who will throw you into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that you won’t get out until you pay every penny of your fine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time some people reported to Yeshua about some Galileans whom Pilate had executed while they were sacrificing animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied to them, “Do you think that this happened to them because they were more sinful than other people from Galilee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No! I can guarantee that they weren’t. But if you don’t turn to God and change the way you think and act, then you, too, will all die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What about those 18 people who died when the tower at Siloam fell on them? Do you think that they were more sinful than other people living in Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No! I can guarantee that they weren’t. But if you don’t turn to God and change the way you think and act, then you, too, will all die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua used this illustration: “A man had a fig tree growing in his vineyard. He went to look for fruit on the tree but didn’t find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the gardener, ‘For the last three years I’ve come to look for figs on this fig tree but haven’t found any. Cut it down! Why should it use up good soil?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The gardener replied, ‘Sir, let it stand for one more year. I’ll dig around it and fertilize it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maybe next year it’ll have figs. But if not, then cut it down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua was teaching in a synagogue on the day of worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman who was possessed by a spirit was there. The spirit had disabled her for 18 years. She was hunched over and couldn’t stand up straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua saw her, he called her to come to him and said, “Woman, you are free from your disability.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed his hands on her, and she immediately stood up straight and praised God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The synagogue leader was irritated with Yeshua for healing on the day of worship. The leader told the crowd, “There are six days when work can be done. So come on one of those days to be healed. Don’t come on the day of worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “You hypocrites! Don’t each of you free your ox or donkey on the day of worship? Don’t you then take it out of its stall to give it some water to drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, here is a descendant of Abraham. Satan has kept her in this condition for 18 years. Isn’t it right to free her on the day of worship?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said this, everyone who opposed him felt ashamed. But the entire crowd was happy about the miraculous things he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked, “What is the kingdom of God like? What can I compare it to?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like a mustard seed that someone planted in a garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds nested in its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked again, “What can I compare the kingdom of God to?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like yeast that a woman mixed into a large amount of flour until the yeast worked its way through all the dough.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua traveled and taught in one city and village after another on his way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Someone asked him, “Sir, are only a few people going to be saved?”
He answered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Try hard to enter through the narrow door. I can guarantee that many will try to enter, but they won’t succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the homeowner gets up and closes the door, it’s too late. You can stand outside, knock at the door, and say, ‘Sir, open the door for us!’ But he will answer you, ‘I don’t know who you are.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will say, ‘We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he will tell you, ‘I don’t know who you are. Get away from me, all you evil people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will cry and be in extreme pain. That’s what you’ll do when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets. They’ll be in the kingdom of God, but you’ll be thrown out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will come from all over the world and will eat in the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some who are last will be first, and some who are first will be last.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time some Pharisees told Yeshua, “Get out of here, and go somewhere else! Herod wants to kill you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “Tell that fox that I will force demons out of people and heal people today and tomorrow. I will finish my work on the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I must be on my way today, tomorrow, and the next day. It’s not possible for a prophet to die outside Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you kill the prophets and stone to death those sent to you! How often I wanted to gather your children together the way a hen gathers her chicks under her wings! But you were not willing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your house will be abandoned. I can guarantee that you will not see me again until you say, ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On a day of worship Yeshua went to eat at the home of a prominent Pharisee. The guests were watching Yeshua very closely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man whose body was swollen with fluid was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua reacted by asking the Pharisees and the experts in Moses’ Teachings, “Is it right to heal on the day of worship or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they didn’t say a thing.
So Yeshua took hold of the man, healed him, and sent him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked them, “If your son or your ox falls into a well on a day of worship, wouldn’t you pull him out immediately?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They couldn’t argue with him about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua noticed how the guests always chose the places of honor. So he used this illustration when he spoke to them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When someone invites you to a wedding, don’t take the place of honor. Maybe someone more important than you was invited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then your host would say to you, ‘Give this person your place.’ Embarrassed, you would have to take the place of least honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when you’re invited, take the place of least honor. Then, when your host comes, he will tell you, ‘Friend, move to a more honorable place.’ Then all the other guests will see how you are honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who honor themselves will be humbled, but people who humble themselves will be honored.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told the man who had invited him, “When you invite people for lunch or dinner, don’t invite only your friends, family, other relatives, or rich neighbors. Otherwise, they will return the favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the handicapped, the lame, and the blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will be blessed because they don’t have any way to pay you back. You will be paid back when those who have God’s approval come back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of those eating with him heard this. So he said to Yeshua, “The person who will be at the banquet in the kingdom of God is blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “A man gave a large banquet and invited many people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was time for the banquet, he sent his servant to tell those who were invited, ‘Come! Everything is ready now.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everyone asked to be excused. The first said to him, ‘I bought a field, and I need to see it. Please excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another said, ‘I bought five pairs of oxen, and I’m on my way to see how well they plow. Please excuse me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still another said, ‘I recently got married, and that’s why I can’t come.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant went back to report this to his master. Then the master of the house became angry. He told his servant, ‘Run to every street and alley in the city! Bring back the poor, the handicapped, the blind, and the lame.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant said, ‘Sir, what you’ve ordered has been done. But there is still room for more people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the master told his servant, ‘Go to the roads and paths! Urge the people to come to my house. I want it to be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that none of those invited earlier will taste any food at my banquet.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Large crowds were traveling with Yeshua. He turned to them and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If people come to me and are not ready to abandon their fathers, mothers, wives, children, brothers, and sisters, as well as their own lives, they cannot be my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who do not carry their crosses and follow me cannot be my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose you want to build a tower. You would first sit down and figure out what it costs. Then you would see if you have enough money to finish it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, if you lay a foundation and can’t finish the building, everyone who watches will make fun of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll say, ‘This person started to build but couldn’t finish the job.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or suppose a king is going to war against another king. He would first sit down and think things through. Can he and his 10,000 soldiers fight against a king with 20,000 soldiers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he can’t, he’ll send ambassadors to ask for terms of peace while the other king is still far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, none of you can be my disciples unless you give up everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good. But if salt loses its taste, how will you restore its flavor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It’s not any good for the ground or for the manure pile. People throw it away.
“Let the person who has ears listen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the tax collectors and sinners came to listen to Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Pharisees and the experts in Moses’ Teachings complained, “This man welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua spoke to them using this illustration:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose a man has 100 sheep and loses one of them. Doesn’t he leave the 99 sheep grazing in the pasture and look for the lost sheep until he finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he finds it, he’s happy. He puts that sheep on his shoulders and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: goes home. Then he calls his friends and neighbors together and says to them, ‘Let’s celebrate! I’ve found my lost sheep!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that there will be more happiness in heaven over one person who turns to God and changes the way he thinks and acts than over 99 people who already have turned to God and have his approval.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose a woman has ten coins and loses one. Doesn’t she light a lamp, sweep the house, and look for the coin carefully until she finds it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, ‘Let’s celebrate! I’ve found the coin that I lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I can guarantee that God’s angels are happy about one person who turns to God and changes the way he thinks and acts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said, “A man had two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger son said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of the property.’ So the father divided his property between his two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After a few days, the younger son gathered his possessions and left for a country far away from home. There he wasted everything he had on a wild lifestyle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had nothing left when a severe famine spread throughout that country. He had nothing to live on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got a job from someone in that country and was sent to feed pigs in the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one in the country would give him any food, and he was so hungry that he would have eaten what the pigs were eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Finally, he came to his senses. He said, ‘How many of my father’s hired men have more food than they can eat, while I’m starving to death here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll go at once to my father, and I’ll say to him, “Father, I’ve sinned against heaven and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I don’t deserve to be called your son anymore. Make me one of your hired men.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So he went at once to his father. While he was still at a distance, his father saw him and felt sorry for him. He ran to his son, put his arms around him, and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his son said to him, ‘Father, I’ve sinned against heaven and you. I don’t deserve to be called your son anymore.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The father said to his servants, ‘Hurry! Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let’s celebrate with a feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My son was dead and has come back to life. He was lost but has been found.’ Then they began to celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His older son was in the field. As he was coming back to the house, he heard music and dancing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called to one of the servants and asked what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The servant told him, ‘Your brother has come home. So your father has killed the fattened calf to celebrate your brother’s safe return.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the older son became angry and wouldn’t go into the house. His father came out and begged him to come in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered his father, ‘All these years I’ve worked like a slave for you. I’ve never disobeyed one of your commands. Yet, you’ve never given me so much as a little goat for a celebration with my friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this son of yours spent your money on prostitutes, and when he came home, you killed the fattened calf for him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “His father said to him, ‘My child, you’re always with me. Everything I have is yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we have something to celebrate, something to be happy about. This brother of yours was dead but has come back to life. He was lost but has been found.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to his disciples, “A rich man had a business manager. The manager was accused of wasting the rich man’s property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the rich man called for his manager and said to him, ‘What’s this I hear about you? Let me examine your books. It’s obvious that you can’t manage my property any longer.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The manager thought, ‘What should I do? My master is taking my job away from me. I’m not strong enough to dig, and I’m ashamed to beg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know what I’ll do so that people will welcome me into their homes when I’ve lost my job.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So the manager called for each one of his master’s debtors. He said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The debtor replied, ‘Eight hundred gallons of olive oil.’
“The manager told him, ‘Take my master’s ledger. Quick! Sit down, and write “four hundred!” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then he asked another debtor, ‘How much do you owe?’
“The debtor replied, ‘A thousand bushels of wheat.’
“The manager told him, ‘Take the ledger, and write “eight hundred!” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The master praised the dishonest manager for being so clever. Worldly people are more clever than spiritually-minded people when it comes to dealing with others.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua continued, “I’m telling you that although wealth is often used in dishonest ways, you should use it to make friends for yourselves. When life is over, you will be welcomed into an eternal home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever can be trusted with very little can also be trusted with a lot. Whoever is dishonest with very little is dishonest with a lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if you can’t be trusted with wealth that is often used dishonestly, who will trust you with wealth that is real?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you can’t be trusted with someone else’s wealth, who will give you your own?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A servant cannot serve two masters. He will hate the first master and love the second, or he will be devoted to the first and despise the second. You cannot serve God and wealth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees, who love money, heard all this and were making sarcastic remarks about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Yeshua said to them, “You try to justify your actions in front of people. But God knows what’s in your hearts. What is important to humans is disgusting to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets were in force until the time of John. Since that time, people have been telling the Good News about the kingdom of God, and everyone is trying to force their way into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for the earth and the heavens to disappear than to drop a comma from the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Any man who divorces his wife to marry another woman is committing adultery. The man who marries a woman divorced in this way is committing adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There was a rich man who wore expensive clothes. Every day was like a party to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was also a beggar named Lazarus who was regularly brought to the gate of the rich man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lazarus would have eaten any scraps that fell from the rich man’s table. Lazarus was covered with sores, and dogs would lick them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “One day the beggar died, and the angels carried him to be with Abraham. The rich man also died and was buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to hell, where he was constantly tortured. As he looked up, in the distance he saw Abraham and Lazarus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He yelled, ‘Father Abraham! Have mercy on me! Send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water to cool off my tongue. I am suffering in this fire.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abraham replied, ‘Remember, my child, that you had a life filled with good times, while Lazarus’ life was filled with misery. Now he has peace here, while you suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, a wide area separates us. People couldn’t cross it in either direction even if they wanted to.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The rich man responded, ‘Then I ask you, Father, to send Lazarus back to my father’s home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have five brothers. He can warn them so that they won’t end up in this place of torture.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abraham replied, ‘They have Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets. Your brothers should listen to them!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The rich man replied, ‘No, Father Abraham! If someone comes back to them from the dead, they will turn to God and change the way they think and act.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abraham answered him, ‘If they won’t listen to Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets, they won’t be persuaded even if someone comes back to life.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told his disciples, “Situations that cause people to lose their faith are certain to arise. But how horrible it will be for the person who causes someone to lose his faith!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It would be best for that person to be thrown into the sea with a large stone hung around his neck than for him to cause one of these little ones to lose his faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So watch yourselves!
“If a believer sins, correct him. If he changes the way he thinks and acts, forgive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if he wrongs you seven times in one day and comes back to you seven times and says that he is sorry, forgive him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the apostles said to the Lord, “Give us more faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “If you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Pull yourself up by the roots, and plant yourself in the sea!’ and it would obey you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose someone has a servant who is plowing fields or watching sheep. Does he tell his servant when he comes from the field, ‘Have something to eat’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No. Instead, he tells his servant, ‘Get dinner ready for me! After you serve me my dinner, you can eat yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He doesn’t thank the servant for following orders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s the way it is with you. When you’ve done everything you’re ordered to do, say, ‘We’re worthless servants. We’ve only done our duty.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee on his way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went into a village, ten men with a skin disease met him. They stood at a distance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shouted, “Yeshua, Teacher, have mercy on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw them, he told them, “Show yourselves to the priests.” As they went, they were made clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When one of them saw that he was healed, he turned back and praised God in a loud voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He quickly bowed at Yeshua’s feet and thanked him. (The man was a Samaritan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua asked, “Weren’t ten men made clean? Where are the other nine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only this foreigner came back to praise God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told the man, “Get up, and go home! Your faith has made you well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Pharisees asked Yeshua when the kingdom of God would come.
He answered them, “People can’t observe the coming of the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They can’t say, ‘Here it is!’ or ‘There it is!’ You see, the kingdom of God is within you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to his disciples, “The time will come when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will say, ‘There he is!’ or ‘Here he is!’ Don’t run after those people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day of the Son of Man will be like lightning that flashes from one end of the sky to the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first he must suffer a lot and be rejected by the people of his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Son of Man comes again, the situation will be like the time of Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People were eating, drinking, and getting married until the day that Noah went into the ship. Then the flood destroyed all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The situation will also be like the time of Lot. People were eating, drinking, buying and selling, planting and building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the day that Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained from the sky and destroyed all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day when the Son of Man is revealed will be like that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On that day those who are on the roof shouldn’t come down to get their belongings out of their houses. Those who are in the field shouldn’t turn back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Lot’s wife!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who try to save their lives will lose them, and those who lose their lives will save them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee that on that night if two people are in one bed, one will be taken and the other one will be left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two women will be grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other one will be left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked him, “Where, Lord?”
Yeshua told them, “Vultures will gather wherever there is a dead body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua used this illustration with his disciples to show them that they need to pray all the time and never give up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “In a city there was a judge who didn’t fear God or respect people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that city there was also a widow who kept coming to him and saying, ‘Give me justice.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For a while the judge refused to do anything. But then he thought, ‘This widow really annoys me. Although I don’t fear God or respect people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll have to give her justice. Otherwise, she’ll keep coming to me until she wears me out.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord added, “Pay attention to what the dishonest judge thought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t God give his chosen people justice when they cry out to him for help day and night? Is he slow to help them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that he will give them justice quickly. But when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua also used this illustration with some who were sure that God approved of them while they looked down on everyone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Two men went into the temple courtyard to pray. One was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisee stood up and prayed, ‘God, I thank you that I’m not like other people! I’m not a robber or a dishonest person. I haven’t committed adultery. I’m not even like this tax collector.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I fast twice a week, and I give you a tenth of my entire income.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the tax collector was standing at a distance. He wouldn’t even look up to heaven. Instead, he became very upset, and he said, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee that this tax collector went home with God’s approval, but the Pharisee didn’t. Everyone who honors himself will be humbled, but the person who humbles himself will be honored.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people brought infants to Yeshua to have him hold them. When the disciples saw this, they told the people not to do that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua called the infants to him and said, “Don’t stop the children from coming to me! Children like these are part of the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee this truth: Whoever doesn’t receive the kingdom of God as a little child receives it will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An official asked Yeshua, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: Never commit adultery. Never murder. Never steal. Never give false testimony. Honor your father and your mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The official replied, “I’ve obeyed all these commandments since I was a boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua heard this, he said to him, “You still need one thing. Sell everything you have. Distribute the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the official heard this, he became sad, because he was very rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua watched him and said, “How hard it is for rich people to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard him asked, “Who, then, can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “The things that are impossible for people to do are possible for God to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter said, “We’ve left everything to follow you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “I can guarantee this truth: Anyone who gave up his home, wife, brothers, parents, or children because of the kingdom of God
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will certainly receive many times as much in this life and will receive eternal life in the world to come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua took the twelve apostles aside and said to them, “We’re going to Jerusalem. Everything that the prophets wrote about the Son of Man will come true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be handed over to foreigners. They will make fun of him, insult him, spit on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whip him, and kill him. But on the third day he will come back to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t understand any of this. What he said was a mystery to them, and they didn’t know what he meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Yeshua came near Jericho, a blind man was sitting and begging by the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard the crowd going by, he tried to find out what was happening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people told him that Yeshua from Nazareth was passing by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the blind man shouted, “Yeshua, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people at the front of the crowd told the blind man to be quiet. But he shouted even louder, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua stopped and ordered them to bring the man to him. When the man came near, Yeshua asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want me to do for you?”
The blind man said, “Lord, I want to see again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told him, “Receive your sight! Your faith has made you well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately, he could see again. He followed Yeshua and praised God. All the people saw this, and they, too, praised God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua was passing through Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Zacchaeus was there. He was the director of tax collectors, and he was rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He tried to see who Yeshua was. But Zacchaeus was a small man, and he couldn’t see Yeshua because of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Zacchaeus ran ahead and climbed a fig tree to see Yeshua, who was coming that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua came to the tree, he looked up and said, “Zacchaeus, come down! I must stay at your house today.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zacchaeus came down and was glad to welcome Yeshua into his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people who saw this began to express disapproval. They said, “He went to be the guest of a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, at dinner, Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, “Lord, I’ll give half of my property to the poor. I’ll pay four times as much as I owe to those I have cheated in any way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to Zacchaeus, “You and your family have been saved today. You’ve shown that you, too, are one of Abraham’s descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the Son of Man has come to seek and to save people who are lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua was getting closer to Jerusalem, and the people thought that the kingdom of God would appear suddenly. While Yeshua had the people’s attention, he used this illustration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “A prince went to a distant country to be appointed king, and then he returned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before he left, he called ten of his servants and gave them ten coins. He said to his servants, ‘Invest this money until I come back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The citizens of his own country hated him. They sent representatives to follow him and say to the person who was going to appoint him, ‘We don’t want this man to be our king.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After he was appointed king, he came back. Then he said, ‘Call those servants to whom I gave money. I want to know how much each one has made by investing.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The first servant said, ‘Sir, the coin you gave me has earned ten times as much.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The king said to him, ‘Good job! You’re a good servant. You proved that you could be trusted with a little money. Take charge of ten cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The second servant said, ‘The coin you gave me, sir, has made five times as much.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The king said to this servant, ‘You take charge of five cities.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the other servant said, ‘Sir, look! Here’s your coin. I’ve kept it in a cloth for safekeeping because
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was afraid of you. You’re a tough person to get along with. You take what isn’t yours and harvest grain you haven’t planted.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The king said to him, ‘I’ll judge you by what you’ve said, you evil servant! You knew that I was a tough person to get along with. You knew that I take what isn’t mine and harvest grain I haven’t planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then why didn’t you put my money in the bank? When I came back, I could have collected it with interest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king told his men, ‘Take his coin away, and give it to the man who has ten.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They replied, ‘Sir, he already has ten coins.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘I can guarantee that everyone who has something will be given more. But everything will be taken away from those who don’t have much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring my enemies, who didn’t want me to be their king. Kill them in front of me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Yeshua had given this illustration, he continued on his way to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came near Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives (as it was called), Yeshua sent two of his disciples ahead of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into the village ahead of you. As you enter, you will find a young donkey tied there. No one has ever sat on it. Untie it, and bring it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you why you are untying it, say that the Lord needs it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men Yeshua sent found it as he had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were untying the young donkey, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying the donkey?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples answered, “The Lord needs it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the donkey to Yeshua, put their coats on it, and helped Yeshua onto it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was riding along, people spread their coats on the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this time he was coming near the place where the road went down the Mount of Olives. Then the whole crowd of disciples began to praise God for all the miracles they had seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shouted joyfully,
“Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord!
    Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to Yeshua, “Teacher, tell your disciples to be quiet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “I can guarantee that if they are quiet, the stones will cry out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came closer and saw the city, he began to cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If you had only known today what would bring you peace! But now it is hidden, so you cannot see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time will come when enemy armies will build a wall to surround you and close you in on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will level you to the ground and kill your people. One stone will not be left on top of another, because you didn’t recognize the time when God came to help you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went into the temple courtyard and began to throw out those who were selling things there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Scripture says, ‘My house will be a house of prayer,’ but you have turned it into a gathering place for thieves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua taught in the temple courtyard every day. The chief priests, the experts in Moses’ Teachings, and the leaders of the people looked for a way to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they could not find a way to do it, because all the people were eager to hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Yeshua was teaching the people in the temple courtyard and telling them the Good News. The chief priests, the experts in Moses’ Teachings, and the leaders came up to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Tell us, what gives you the right to do these things? Who told you that you could do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua answered them, “I, too, have a question for you. Tell me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: did John’s right to baptize come from heaven or from humans?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They talked about this among themselves. They said, “If we say, ‘from heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘from humans,’ everyone will stone us to death. They’re convinced that John was a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they answered that they didn’t know who gave John the right to baptize.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua told them, “Then I won’t tell you why I have the right to do these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, using this illustration, Yeshua spoke to the people: “A man planted a vineyard, leased it to vineyard workers, and went on a long trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the right time he sent a servant to the workers to obtain from them a share of the grapes from the vineyard. But the workers beat the servant and sent him back with nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent a different servant. The workers beat him, treated him shamefully, and sent him back with nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent a third servant. But they injured this one and threw him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What should I do? I’ll send my son, whom I love. They’ll probably respect him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the workers saw him, they talked it over among themselves. They said, ‘This is the heir. Let’s kill him so that the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him.
“What will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will destroy these workers and give the vineyard to others.”
Those who heard him said, “That’s unthinkable!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Yeshua looked straight at them and asked, “What, then, does this Scripture verse mean:
‘The stone that the builders rejected
    has become the cornerstone’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken. If that stone falls on anyone, it will crush that person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in Moses’ Teachings and the chief priests wanted to arrest him right there, but they were afraid of the people. They knew that he had directed this illustration at them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they watched for an opportunity to send out some spies. The spies were to act like sincere religious people. They wanted to catch him saying the wrong thing so that they could hand him over to the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Teacher, we know that you’re right in what you say and teach. Besides, you don’t play favorites. Rather, you teach the way of God truthfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it right for us to pay taxes to the emperor or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw through their scheme, so he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Show me a coin. Whose face and name is this?”
They answered, “The emperor’s.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Well, then give the emperor what belongs to the emperor, and give God what belongs to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They couldn’t make him say anything wrong in front of the people. His answer surprised them, so they said no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Sadducees, who say that people will never come back to life, came to Yeshua. They asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us, ‘If a married man dies and has no children, his brother should marry his widow and have children for his brother.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven brothers. The first got married and died without having children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the second brother married the widow,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so did the third. In the same way all seven brothers married the widow, died, and left no children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, the woman died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, when the dead come back to life, whose wife will she be? The seven brothers had married her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “In this world people get married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But people who are considered worthy to come back to life and live in the next world will neither marry
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor die anymore. They are the same as the angels. They are God’s children who have come back to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even Moses showed in the passage about the bush that the dead come back to life. He says that the Lord is the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He’s not the God of the dead but of the living. In God’s sight all people are living.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some experts in Moses’ Teachings responded, “Teacher, that was well said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time on, no one dared to ask him another question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “How can people say that the Messiah is David’s son?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David says in the book of Psalms,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
    “Take the highest position in heaven
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make your enemies your footstool.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David calls him Lord. So how can he be his son?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While all the people were listening, Yeshua said to the disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Beware of the experts in Moses’ Teachings! They like to walk around in long robes and love to be greeted in the marketplaces, to have the front seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at dinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rob widows by taking their houses and then say long prayers to make themselves look good. The experts in Moses’ Teachings will receive the most severe punishment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Looking up, Yeshua saw people, especially the rich, dropping their gifts into the temple offering box.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He noticed a poor widow drop in two small coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I can guarantee this truth: This poor widow has given more than all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these people have given what they could spare. But she, in her poverty, has given everything she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the disciples were talking about the temple complex. They noted that it was built with fine stones and decorated with beautiful gifts. So Yeshua said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “About these buildings that you see—the time will come when not one of these stones will be left on top of another. Each one will be torn down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples asked him, “Teacher, when will this happen? What will be the sign when all this will occur?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said, “Be careful that you are not deceived. Many will come using my name. They will say, ‘I am he!’ and ‘The time is near.’ Don’t follow them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you hear of wars and revolutions, don’t be terrified! These things must happen first, but the end will not come immediately.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua continued, “Nation will fight against nation and kingdom against kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be terrible earthquakes, famines, and dreadful diseases in various places. Terrifying sights and miraculous signs will come from the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Before all these things happen, people will arrest and persecute you. They will hand you over to their synagogues and put you into their prisons. They will drag you in front of kings and governors because of my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be your opportunity to testify to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So make up your minds not to worry beforehand how you will defend yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give you words and wisdom that none of your enemies will be able to oppose or prove wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even parents, brothers, relatives, and friends will betray you and kill some of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will hate you because you are committed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But not a hair on your head will be lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By your endurance you will save your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you see armies camped around Jerusalem, realize that the time is near for it to be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those of you in Judea should flee to the mountains. Those of you in Jerusalem should leave it. Those of you in the fields shouldn’t go back into them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be a time of vengeance. Everything that is written about it will come true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for women who are pregnant or who are nursing babies in those days. Indeed, the land will suffer very hard times, and its people will be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Swords will cut them down, and they will be carried off into all nations as prisoners. Nations will trample Jerusalem until the times allowed for the nations to do this are over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Miraculous signs will occur in the sun, moon, and stars. The nations of the earth will be deeply troubled and confused because of the roaring and tossing of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will faint as they fearfully wait for what will happen to the world. Indeed, the powers of the universe will be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then people will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When these things begin to happen, stand with confidence! The time when you will be set free is near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua used this story as an illustration. “Look at the fig tree or any other tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as leaves grow on them, you know without being told that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when you see these things happen, you know that the kingdom of God is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can guarantee this truth: This generation will not disappear until all this takes place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth and the heavens will disappear, but my words will never disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make sure that you don’t become drunk, hung over, and worried about life. Then that day could suddenly catch you by surprise
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: like a trap that catches a bird. That day will surprise all people who live on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be alert at all times. Pray so that you have the power to escape everything that is about to happen and to stand in front of the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the day Yeshua would teach in the temple courtyard. But at night he would go to the Mount of Olives (as it was called) and spend the night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of the people would get up early to hear him speak in the temple courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Festival of Unleavened Bread, called Passover, was near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings were looking for some way to kill Yeshua. However, they were afraid of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan entered Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas went to the chief priests and the temple guards and discussed with them how he could betray Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were pleased and agreed to give him some money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas promised to do it. He kept looking for an opportunity to betray Yeshua to them when there was no crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day came during the Festival of Unleavened Bread when the Passover lamb had to be killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua sent Peter and John and told them, “Go, prepare the Passover lamb for us to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Where do you want us to prepare it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Go into the city, and you will meet a man carrying a jug of water. Follow him into the house he enters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell the owner of the house that the teacher asks, ‘Where is the room where I can eat the Passover meal with my disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take you upstairs and show you a large furnished room. Get things ready there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples left. They found everything as Yeshua had told them and prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was time to eat the Passover meal, Yeshua and the apostles were at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “I’ve had a deep desire to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that I won’t eat it again until it finds its fulfillment in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a cup and spoke a prayer of thanksgiving. He said, “Take this, and share it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that from now on I won’t drink this wine until the kingdom of God comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua took bread and spoke a prayer of thanksgiving. He broke the bread, gave it to them, and said, “This is my body, which is given up for you. Do this to remember me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When supper was over, he did the same with the cup. He said, “This cup that is poured out for you is the new promise made with my blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The hand of the one who will betray me is with me on the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man is going to die the way it has been planned for him. But how horrible it will be for that person who betrays him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they began to discuss with each other who could do such a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a quarrel broke out among the disciples. They argued about who should be considered the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to them, “The kings of nations have power over their people, and those in authority call themselves friends of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you’re not going to be that way! Rather, the greatest among you must be like the youngest, and your leader must be like a servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who’s the greatest, the person who sits at the table or the servant? Isn’t it really the person who sits at the table? But I’m among you as a servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have stood by me in the troubles that have tested me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So as my Father has given me a kingdom, I’m giving it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat and drink at my table in my kingdom. You will also sit on thrones and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Simon, Simon, listen! Satan has demanded to have you apostles for himself. He wants to separate you from me as a farmer separates wheat from husks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith will not fail. So when you recover, strengthen the other disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “Lord, I’m ready to go to prison with you and to die with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua replied, “Peter, I can guarantee that the rooster won’t crow tonight until you say three times that you don’t know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Yeshua said to them, “When I sent you out without a wallet, traveling bag, or sandals, you didn’t lack anything, did you?”
“Not a thing!” they answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “But now, the person who has a wallet and a traveling bag should take them along. The person who doesn’t have a sword should sell his coat and buy one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can guarantee that the Scripture passage which says, ‘He was counted with criminals,’ must find its fulfillment in me. Indeed, whatever is written about me will come true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The disciples said, “Lord, look! Here are two swords!”
Then Yeshua said to them, “That’s enough!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua went out of the city to the Mount of Olives as he usually did. His disciples followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he arrived, he said to them, “Pray that you won’t be tempted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he withdrew from them about a stone’s throw, knelt down, and prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, if it is your will, take this cup of suffering away from me. However, your will must be done, not mine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and gave him strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he prayed very hard in anguish. His sweat became like drops of blood falling to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Yeshua ended his prayer, he got up and went to the disciples. He found them asleep and overcome with sadness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Why are you sleeping? Get up, and pray that you won’t be tempted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was still speaking to the disciples, a crowd arrived. The man called Judas, one of the twelve apostles, was leading them. He came close to Yeshua to kiss him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “Judas, do you intend to betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who were with Yeshua saw what was going to happen. So they asked him, “Lord, should we use our swords to fight?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the disciples cut off the right ear of the chief priest’s servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yeshua said, “Stop! That’s enough of this.” Then he touched the servant’s ear and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to the chief priests, temple guards, and leaders who had come for him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs as if I were a criminal?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I was with you in the temple courtyard every day and you didn’t try to arrest me. But this is your time, when darkness rules.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they arrested Yeshua and led him away to the chief priest’s house.
Peter followed at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men had lit a fire in the middle of the courtyard. As they sat together, Peter sat among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A female servant saw him as he sat facing the glow of the fire. She stared at him and said, “This man was with Yeshua.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter denied it by saying, “I don’t know him, woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little later someone else saw Peter and said, “You are one of them.”
But Peter said, “Not me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About an hour later another person insisted, “It’s obvious that this man was with him. He’s a Galilean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Peter said, “I don’t know what you’re talking about!”
Just then, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord turned and looked directly at Peter. Peter remembered what the Lord had said: “Before a rooster crows today, you will say three times that you don’t know me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter went outside and cried bitterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who were guarding Yeshua made fun of him as they beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They blindfolded him and said to him, “Tell us who hit you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also insulted him in many other ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning the council of the people’s leaders, the chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings, gathered together. They brought Yeshua in front of their highest court and asked him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Tell us, are you the Messiah?”
Yeshua said to them, “If I tell you, you won’t believe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I ask you, you won’t answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from now on, the Son of Man will be in the highest position in heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then all of them said, “So you’re the Son of God?”
Yeshua answered them, “You’re right to say that I am.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Why do we need any more testimony? We’ve heard him say it ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the entire assembly stood up and took him to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began to accuse Yeshua by saying, “We found that he stirs up trouble among our people: He keeps them from paying taxes to the emperor, and he says that he is Christ, a king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
“Yes, I am,” Yeshua answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowd, “I can’t find this man guilty of any crime.”
