verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests and the crowd became more forceful. They said, “He stirs up the people throughout Judea with his teachings. He started in Galilee and has come here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard that, he asked if the man was from Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate found out that he was, he sent Yeshua to Herod. Herod ruled Galilee and was in Jerusalem at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod was very pleased to see Yeshua. For a long time he had wanted to see him. He had heard about Yeshua and hoped to see him perform some kind of miracle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod asked Yeshua many questions, but Yeshua wouldn’t answer him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the chief priests and the experts in Moses’ Teachings stood there and shouted their accusations against Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herod and his soldiers treated Yeshua with contempt and made fun of him. They put a colorful robe on him and sent him back to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herod and Pilate became friends that day. They had been enemies before this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “You brought me this man as someone who turns the people against the government. I’ve questioned him in front of you and haven’t found this man guilty of the crimes of which you accuse him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither could Herod. So he sent this man back to us. This man hasn’t done anything to deserve the death penalty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I’m going to have him whipped and set free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole crowd then shouted, “Take him away! Free Barabbas for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Barabbas had been thrown into prison for his involvement in a riot that had taken place in the city and for murder.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because Pilate wanted to free Yeshua, he spoke to the people again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They began yelling, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A third time Pilate spoke to them. He asked, “Why? What has he done wrong? I haven’t found this man deserving of the death penalty. So I’m going to have him whipped and set free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the crowd pressured Pilate. They shouted that Yeshua had to be crucified, and they finally won.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate decided to give in to their demand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He freed Barabbas, who had been put in prison for rioting and murdering, because that’s what they wanted. But he let them do what they wanted to Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the soldiers led Yeshua away, they grabbed a man named Simon, who was from the city of Cyrene. Simon was coming into Jerusalem. They laid the cross on him and made him carry it behind Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large crowd followed Yeshua. The women in the crowd cried and sang funeral songs for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua turned to them and said, “You women of Jerusalem, don’t cry for me! Rather, cry for yourselves and your children!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time is coming when people will say, ‘Blessed are the women who couldn’t get pregnant, who couldn’t give birth, and who couldn’t nurse a child.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then people will say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and to the hills, ‘Cover us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If people do this to a green tree, what will happen to a dry one?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two others, who were criminals, were led away to be executed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the place called The Skull, they crucified him. The criminals were also crucified, one on his right and the other on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Yeshua said, “Father, forgive them. They don’t know what they’re doing.”
Meanwhile, the soldiers divided his clothes among themselves by throwing dice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people stood there watching. But the rulers were making sarcastic remarks. They said, “He saved others. If he’s the Messiah that God has chosen, let him save himself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers also made fun of him. They would go up to him, offer him some vinegar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, “If you’re the king of the Jews, save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A written notice was placed above him. It said, “This is the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the criminals hanging there insulted Yeshua by saying, “So you’re really the Messiah, are you? Well, save yourself and us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other criminal scolded him: “Don’t you fear God at all? Can’t you see that you’re condemned in the same way that he is?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our punishment is fair. We’re getting what we deserve. But this man hasn’t done anything wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Yeshua, remember me when you enter your kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua said to him, “I can guarantee this truth: Today you will be with me in paradise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Around noon darkness came over the entire land and lasted until three in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun had stopped shining. The curtain in the temple was split in two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yeshua cried out in a loud voice, “Father, into your hands I entrust my spirit.” After he said this, he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When an army officer saw what had happened, he praised God and said, “Certainly, this man was innocent!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crowds had gathered to see the sight. But when all of them saw what had happened, they cried and returned to the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All his friends, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance and watched everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a good man who had God’s approval. His name was Joseph. He was a member of the Jewish council,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he had not agreed with what they had done. He was from the Jewish city of Arimathea, and he was waiting for the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he took it down from the cross, he wrapped it in linen. Then he laid the body in a tomb cut in rock, a tomb in which no one had ever been buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was Friday, and the day of worship was just beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women who had come with Yeshua from Galilee followed closely behind Joseph. They observed the tomb and how his body was laid in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went back to the city and prepared spices and perfumes. But on the day of worship they rested according to the commandment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early on Sunday morning the women went to the tomb. They were carrying the spices that they had prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they went in, they did not find the body of the Lord Yeshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were puzzled about this, two men in clothes that were as bright as lightning suddenly stood beside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The women were terrified and bowed to the ground.
The men asked the women, “Why are you looking among the dead for the living one?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He’s not here. He has been brought back to life! Remember what he told you while he was still in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘The Son of Man must be handed over to sinful people, be crucified, and come back to life on the third day.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the women remembered what Yeshua had told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women left the tomb and went back to the city. They told everything to the eleven apostles and all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The women were Mary from Magdala, Joanna, and Mary (the mother of James). There were also other women with them. They told the apostles everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles thought that the women’s story didn’t make any sense, and they didn’t believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. He bent down to look inside and saw only the strips of linen. Then he went away, wondering what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the same day, two of Yeshua’s disciples were going to a village called Emmaus. It was about seven miles from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were talking to each other about everything that had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were talking, Yeshua approached them and began walking with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although they saw him, they didn’t recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He asked them, “What are you discussing?”
They stopped and looked very sad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, Cleopas, replied, “Are you the only one in Jerusalem who doesn’t know what has happened recently?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What happened?” he asked.
They said to him, “We were discussing what happened to Yeshua from Nazareth. He was a powerful prophet in what he did and said in the sight of God and all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our chief priests and rulers had him condemned to death and crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We were hoping that he was the one who would free Israel. What’s more, this is now the third day since everything happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the women from our group startled us. They went to the tomb early this morning
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and didn’t find his body. They told us that they had seen angels who said that he’s alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of our men went to the tomb and found it empty, as the women had said, but they didn’t see him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua said to them, “How foolish you are! You’re so slow to believe everything the prophets said!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Didn’t the Messiah have to suffer these things and enter into his glory?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he began with Moses’ Teachings and the Prophets to explain to them what was said about him throughout the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came near the village where they were going, Yeshua acted as if he were going farther.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They urged him, “Stay with us! It’s getting late, and the day is almost over.” So he went to stay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was at the table with them, he took bread and blessed it. He broke the bread and gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then their eyes were opened, and they recognized him. But he vanished from their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Weren’t we excited when he talked with us on the road and opened up the meaning of the Scriptures for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same hour they went back to Jerusalem. They found the eleven apostles and those who were with them gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were saying, “The Lord has really come back to life and has appeared to Simon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the two disciples told what had happened on the road and how they had recognized Yeshua when he broke the bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were talking about what had happened, Yeshua stood among them. He said to them, “Peace be with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were terrified, and thought they were seeing a ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them, “Why are you afraid? Why do you have doubts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at my hands and feet, and see that it’s really me. Touch me, and see for yourselves. Ghosts don’t have flesh and bones, but you can see that I do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were overcome with joy and amazement because this seemed too good to be true. Then Yeshua asked them, “Do you have anything to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave him a piece of broiled fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took it and ate it while they watched him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “These are the words I spoke to you while I was still with you. I told you that everything written about me in Moses’ Teachings, the Prophets, and the Psalms had to come true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Scripture says that the Messiah would suffer and that he would come back to life on the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Scripture also says that by the authority of Yeshua people would be told to turn to God and change the way they think and act so that their sins will be forgiven. This would be told to people from all nations, beginning in the city of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are witnesses to these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m sending you what my Father promised. Wait here in the city until you receive power from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yeshua took them to a place near Bethany. There he raised his hands and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was blessing them, he left them and was taken to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples worshiped him and were overjoyed as they went back to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were always in the temple, where they praised God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
